newsitem.title: USA: Verity's stock plunges on bigger loss forecast.
newsitem.headline: Verity's stock plunges on bigger loss forecast.

text.p: Verity Inc. stock lost almost half its value Friday, a day after it said it expected to post a fiscal first-quarter net loss of about $1.3 million, or triple its loss for the same period last year.
The company's shares plunged $11.25, almost 47 percent, to $12.875 on the Nasdaq market, where it was one of the most heavily traded issues with more than 2 million shares changing hands by midday.

Verity said late Thursday that it expected to post a loss of about $1.3 million, or 12 cents a share, in the three months ended Aug. 31. That compared with a loss of $436,000, or 21 cents a share on a smaller number of shares, for the same quarter a year ago.

The Sunnyvale, Calif.-based provider of software products also said it expected first-quater revenues to total about $8.8 million, up from $5.5 million a year ago, but down from $10 million in its fiscal fourth quarter.
